column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/0df65da397f5b1927783f7a8dba2f69e1cfef3ff for binaries and test log.\n

Needs unit tests and a thorough test plan. If you want this to be pulled, you'll also need a user-friendly discussion of what this changes and how it affects SatoshiDice, how it affects users who might already have coin dust in their wallets, etc.

Or, in other words: writing the code is the easy part...
Oh, frankly I'm surprised you think the issue is settled enough to be writing that stuff at that stage; I wasn't expecting this to be anywhere close to being pulled yet.\n
If it isn't anywhere close to being pulled, why did you submit it?  I don't like "Pull Request As A Forum For Discussion" ...\n
(oh, WHY I don't like pull-request-as-a-forum-for-discussion:  because it make my job harder, and wastes people time reviewing code that may never have a chance of being pulled)\n

Oh, I see you just want pull-reqs saved for code that has already had the initial discussion about it specifically done elsewhere; the pros and cons of the basic idea and varients have been discussed endlessly elsewhere.\n
Closing; please re-open when this is ready for pulling into mainline.\n
Recent data spam seems to make this worth revisiting, and re-opening.\n
